meanings.sent1: The mayor decided to renominate the current city council member for another term.
meanings.sent2: I will renominate my friend for the student council elections next year.
meanings.sent3: After his cat knocked over the vase, he jokingly renominated the cat for 'clumsiest pet'.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to renominate herself for the position after her initial application was lost in the mail.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's pet hamster was so well-behaved that the class decided to renominate it as the class mascot.

meanings.definition: Propose (someone) as a candidate for an office or position again.
meanings.sent1: The committee will renominate the current president for the upcoming election.
meanings.sent2: I plan to renominate my sister for the role of team captain next season.
meanings.sent3: In a surprising turn of events, they decided to renominate the retired janitor for the CEO position.
meanings.sent4: The talented actor was renominated for the prestigious award for the third year in a row.
meanings.sent5: The loyal employee was renominated for the 'Employee of the Month' award due to her hard work and dedication.
